resources.string: Failed to initialize Vuforia. This device is not supported.

Failed to initialize Vuforia because the camera is not accessible. If using a webcam check that it is connected to a USB hub. If using either the phone camera or a webcam check that the application has the Camera permission.
This app license key has been canceled and may no longer be used. Please get a new license key.
Invalid Vuforia App Key used. See the Vuforia Samples for comments on obtaining a Vuforia Key.
Vuforia App key is not valid for this product. Please get a valid key, by logging into your account at developer.vuforia.com and choosing the right product type during project creation.
Vuforia App key is missing. Please get a valid key, by logging into your account at developer.vuforia.com and creating a new project.
No network available. Please make sure you are connected to the Internet.
Unable to contact server. Please try again later.
Vuforia App key is not valid for this product. Please get a valid key, by logging into your account at developer.vuforia.com and choosing the right product type during project creation.
Firmware update of %s failed. Please try again.
Firmware update of %s failed because %s. Please try again.
Firmware update of %s timed out. Please try again.
Your device lacks system support for selecting files.
Another Driver Station is already connected to the Robot Controller
App color scheme has changed. The driver station will restart.
App color scheme has changed. The robot controller will restart.
"The APK file was successfully loaded. Now attempting installation of the %s."
Backing up data, uninstalling, and installing new version of app.
The APK failed to install, and the backed up APK failed to restore. Reverted to the version that came with the Control Hub.
The APK failed to install, and the backed up APK failed to restore. Try installing the app via ADB.
The APK failed to install. Please try again. See the log file for details.
The provided APK is not an allowable application.
The APK is not compatible with this device.
The APK installation was aborted. Please try again.
The APK installation was blocked. See the log file for details.
The APK file is reported as invalid.
An IOException occurred while loading the APK. Please try again.
Rebooting with new AP service in place.
"There is an issue with the device's storage."
The APK took too long to install. Please try again.
The previously installed app failed to uninstall.

"The provided APK conflicts with the currently installed version of the app. %s
Do you want to uninstall the currently installed app? This will reset the current network name, password, active configuration, and other settings. Your Blocks and OnBotJava programs will stay intact."

"The provided APK conflicts with the currently installed version of the app. %s
Do you want to uninstall the currently installed app? Your Blocks and OnBotJava programs will not be affected, and other app data will be backed up first, so your settings should remain intact."
Uninstalling existing app and installing new one.
Got unrecognized response from package installer.

"These are the configurations the Hardware Wizard was able to find. You can edit each configuration by clicking the edit button. The 'Activate' button will set that configuration as the current one, which will be used to start the robot."
Available USB controllers to swap with:
This device does not include the ControlHubUpdater.
Which kind of motor is attached?
Which kind of servo is attached?
The specified file does not exist.
The device has not finished startup operations.
Failed to open the Device Manager
Several robot configuration templates are available. Configuring your robot using one of these templates is the fastest way to get a new robot up and running.
Giving up on command %1$s(%2$d) after %3$d attempts
Please enter a name for the robot configuration.
"Press 'Config' to add a configuration to your robot using a template. Press 'Info' to learn what devices a template needs."
Are you sure you want to delete this configuration?
Updating Control Hub firmware with \"%1$s\". Please do not remove power.
Giving up on command %1$s(%2$d) after %3$d attempts
"To attempt recovery, please restart the robot. "
Edit Core Device Interface Module Controller
Expansion Hub \"%s\" was missing at startup. Robot Restart required for hub operation
Failed to open the Device Manager
"OpMode '%1$s' stuck in %2$s. Restarting robot controller app."
Updating Expansion Hub %1$s firmware with \"%2$s\". Please do not unplug.
Unable to fix \"%1$s\": no unique replacement %2$s attached
Unable to fix \"%1$s\": no replacement %2$s attached
The scan for devices on the USB bus failed.
The Robot Controller and Driver Station apps are incompatible with each other. Update the %s app.
Not a valid match number. Valid numbers are 0 - 1000
Enter the name for this legacy module here

"The Driver Station has detected that it can not find any WifiDirect peers and Location Services is turned off at a System Level. Google's Android operating system, Oreo and above, requires Locations Services to be on in order to scan for Wifi Direct peers. Pressing Ok will redirect you to the Location Services setting page where this may be enabled."
another firmware update is already in progress
Place any downloaded REV Hub firmware updates you wish to install in this folder. You can then install those updates using the Advanced Settings menu on the Driver Station or Robot Controller.
reported that the battery is currently too low to run motors and servos.
temporarily reported that the battery was too low to run motors and servos while an Op Mode was running.
reported a temporary complete power loss while an Op Mode was running. Unexpected behavior may result.
temporarily stopped responding to commands while an Op Mode was running
No Expansion Hubs are connected. Please connect one or more Expansion Hubs via USB, and try again.

Each Expansion Hub connected to a robot controller over the same USB connection (wired or embedded) must have a hub address which is unique within that connection. This screen allows these persistent hub addresses to be changed.
Expansion Hubs with the following serial numbers and addresses are currently connected. To change the address of a hub, select a new address from the dropdown.
No REV Hub firmware update files were found on the robot controller. Please download firmware updates to \"%s\", and try again.
No Expansion Hubs are connected. Please connect one or more Expansion Hubs via USB, and try again.
REV Hubs that will be updated:

"Note that Expansion Hubs are only available for firmware update if they are plugged in directly via USB (not RS485).
WARNING: While the firmware update is in progress, do not unplug hubs or restart the robot, or a hub may need to be updated again before it can be used."
Enter the name for this matrix controller here
Modern Robotics USB Core Device Interface Module
REV Robotics USB Expansion Hub Portal
Modern Robotics USB DC Motor Controller
Enter the name for this motor controller here
If you scan, your current unsaved changes may be lost.

These are the devices discovered on the USB bus. You can click on the name of each device to edit the information relating to that device. Make sure each device has a unique name. The names should match what you use in your OpMode code. Scroll down to see more devices if there are any.
Clicking the Save button will create a configuration in the \"/sdcard/FIRST/\" folder inside the robot controller phone. This configuration will be used to initialize the robot.
"Connect your laptop's wireless adapter to the following network:"
"In order to find devices: 1. Attach a robot 2. Press the 'Scan' button"
In order to proceed, you must create a new configuration
"Not all the USB devices needed for this configuration were found. The ones missing are annotated as '%s'."
a Modern Robotics optical distance sensor
This update file does not support this device.
"This update file is older than the currently running operating system. Are you sure you want to install it?"
Error reading the uploaded update file. Please try again.
Update failed to install. Please try again.
The file must be in the external storage folder.

Update verification succeeded. Rebooting device and installing update.

The Control Hub will stop broadcasting its WiFi access point for about a minute, so you may need to manually re-connect in order to see if the update succeeded.
Update verification succeeded. Rebooting device and installing update.

"Make sure that the FTC Robot Controller app is open on your other device, and that both devices have wifi enabled.
Choose from the following list of Robot Controller phones. Non-matching/incorrectly named phones will not appear. Robot Controller names need to begin with the team number matching your Driver Station."
Use the following passphrase to gain access to the network:

The SDK infrastructure does WiFi scans to help with pairing of phones. Knowing what access points are available can allow an application to know an approximation of its location. Even though the SDK does not use location information, Android requires that we ask for this permission. It is not possible to run the application without this permission. You must allow all permissions.
The Driver Station must be able to access external storage for robot logging. It is not possible to run the application without this permission. You must allow all permissions.
The Driver Station must be able to access external storage for robot logging. It is not possible to run the application without this permission. You must allow all permissions.
It is not possible to run the application without this permission. You must allow all permissions.
Permission has been permanently denied for one or more resources. The %s can not run.
Click here to be redirected to the Settings activity, then select Permissions and enable %s

The Robot Controller must be able to access the camera in order to enable Vuforia and Tensorflow features. Regardless of whether or not your OpMode uses these features, you must allow this permission. It is not possible to run the application without this permission. You must allow all permissions.

The Robot Controller must be able to access external storage for the Blocks and OnBot Java developement environments and robot logging. It is not possible to run the application without this permission. You must allow all permissions.

The Robot Controller must be able to access external storage for the Blocks and OnBot Java developement environments and robot logging. It is not possible to run the application without this permission. You must allow all permissions.

The SDK uses this to access the device serial number. This may be used for diagnostic purposes. FIRST does not store the serial number off device or use it in any other fashion. Android requires that we ask for this permission. It is not possible to run the application without this permission. You must allow all permissions.
Check your wiring, battery, and power switch
Adds the ability to specify match numbers and store per-match log files in /sdcard/FIRST/matchlogs on the robot controller.
Change the color scheme of the driver station. Will take effect on next app launch.
Change the color scheme of the robot controller. Note: the app will restart if the color scheme is changed
Clears remembered Wifi Direct groups from the robot controller
Record low-level internal events to the log. This may generate a large log volume.
Name invalid. Valid formats are 9999-RC/DS or 9999-X-DS/RC where X is a letter identifier used to distinguish multiple pairs of phones.
Change the name of this device
Change the name of the driver station
Change the name of the robot controller
Changes the Wifi channel on which the phone-based robot controller operates
Creates a self-inspection report for the driver station
Creates a self-inspection report for the robot controller
Change the robot controller this driver station is paired with
Turn app sounds on or off
Turn driver station app sounds on or off
Turn robot controller app sounds on or off
Shows recently-logged activity of the robot controller.
Turn wifi off automatically after a period of inactivity.
Read-only configurations can be edited, but must be saved under a new name.
Select an XML file to instantiate a Robot from that file
"Press the 'Scan' button to rescan for attached devices"
a REV 2M (Time of Flight) Distance Sensor
REV Robotics UltraPlanetary HD Hex Motor

When running on a REV Control Hub (and only on a Control Hub, not merely a robot controller phone), any Android applications (APK files) found in this folder will be automatically installed when the system boots. Once successfully installed, each APK is deleted so as to not be reinstalled on subsequent boots.
Make sure that your robot is turned on
waiting for network to become active
waiting for Wifi Direct to enable
"Press the 'Save' button to persistently save the current configuration"
"Save your changes before exiting this configuration? If you click 'Exit Without Saving' your changes will be lost."
"Save your changes before exiting this screen? If you click 'Exit Without Saving' your changes will be lost."
Once connected, enter the following address into your web browser:
Enter the name for this servo controller here
"Unable to change Wifi Direct channel to '%s'"
The password you set on the RobotController in SoftAP mode

"Make sure that the FTC Robot Controller app is open on your other device, that you have specified the SSID and password, and that both devices have wifi enabled.
Choose from the following list of Robot Controller phones. Non-matching/incorrectly named phones will not appear. Robot Controller names need to begin with the team number matching your Driver Station."
Click on an item to change the Wifi Direct channel.

The Robot Controller contains the following Wifi Direct remembered groups. Click on the button at the bottom to clear these groups. Clearing groups in this way can at times help alleviate network connectivity issues.
Change advanced settings of the robot controller
Change the persistent hub address of one or more Expansion Hubs
Updates the firmware of all USB-attached Expansion Hubs
Updates the firmware of the Control Hub and all USB-attached Expansion Hubs
Show warning when the Robot Controller access point is on the 2.4 GHz WiFi band, and both the Robot Controller and Driver Station support 5 GHz
Show warning when the Robot Controller and Driver Station are not the same version
Show warning when outdated REV Hub firmware is detected

"Asked Robot Controller to change to channel '%s'. A restart of the Driver Station may be needed."
Wifi Direct remembered groups have been cleared from the robot controller.
Running on an unknown type of Control Hub. Are you using the latest version of the software?
You are using the 2.4 GHz WiFi band when both the Robot Controller and Driver Station support 5 GHz. You should consider changing to a 5 GHz WiFi channel
The Robot Controller and Driver Station app versions do not match. You should consider updating the %s app

Enter the name for this webcam here

"Wireless access point pairing is used to pair a driver station with a robot controller running on a Control Hub (use WifiDirect to pair with other robot controllers).
Each Control Hub robot controller hosts its own Wifi network named with the name of the robot controller (default password: \"password\"). Click the button below to use the system Wifi Settings of your driver station to select the network of the robot controller you want to pair with."
The Wifi-Direct device name contains non-printable characters. Please go into the Wifi-Direct settings menu and rename this device.
unknown; is WIFI turned on on this phone?
Please wait while we update the Wifi Direct settings on this device.
Select an XML file to instantiate a Robot from that file
Press this button to write the current configuration to an XML file
